title: iOS 18 makes iPhone more personal, capable, and intelligent than ever

Users will be able to arrange apps and widgets in any open space on the Home Screen, customize the buttons at the bottom of the Lock Screen, and quickly access more controls in Control Center. Photo libraries are automatically organized.

Vision Pro users can quickly and easily find their favorite spatial photos in the redesigned Photos app, manage information across all.

title: Introducing Apple Intelligence, the personal intelligence system that puts powerful generative models at the core of iPhone, iPad, and Mac
text: CUPERTINO, Calif.--(BUSINESS WIRE)--Apple® today introduced Apple Intelligence™, the personal intelligence system for iPhone®, iPad®, and Mac® that combines the power of generative models with personal context to deliver intelligence that's incredibly useful and relevant. Apple Intelligence is deeply integrated into iOS 18, iPadOS® 18, and macOS® Sequoia. It harnesses the power of Apple silicon to understand and create language and images, take action across apps, and draw from personal context.

title: Justice Dept. Sues Apple, Smartphones and Children with Jonathan Haidt and Reddit's I.P.O.
text: This week, the U.S. Department of Justice sued Apple, saying the company holds a monopoly over the smartphone market. We break down the lawsuit and ask whether it will be a major turning point in Apple's dominance. Then, Jonathan Haidt, a social psychologist, argues that smartphones and social media are the cause of widespread increases in mental health issues among young people. He tells us his four potential solutions to the problem. title: Apple stock to start the week lower amid Foxconn probe
text: Apple Inc (NASDAQ:AAPL) stock is on the back foot ahead of Monday's opening bell, down nearly 1% to $171.16, amid reports of an investigation into Taiwan-headquartered iPhone manufacturer Foxconn. The Chinese mainland tax authorities are probing key enterprises of Foxconn in Guangdong, Jiangsu, and other provinces, according to a report by The Global Times.

title: China government launches tax probes into Apple iPhone maker Foxconn
text: Chinese authorities have launched multiple investigations into iPhone-maker Foxconn's tax and land use, sources told local news site Global Times. Tax authorities inspected Foxconn's sites in the provinces of Guangdong and Jiangsu, and natural resources officials have conducted on-site investigations in Henan and Hubei, the anonymous sources told Global Times.

title: Apple Stock: Not Attractive At Current Earnings Multiple, Possible Q4 Earnings Miss
text: Back in 2015 to 2017, Apple stock enjoyed a low multiple and an ability to repurchase shares economically to boost EPS growth. Six to seven years on and the multiple for Apple stock is far above historical average and difficult to justify based on earnings outlook reflected in analysts' EPS estimates. The factors that indicated a buying opportunity in the 2015 to 2017 period have reversed in 2023 and Apple stock is downgraded from Buy to Sell.
